notes.text:
An update for webkit2gtk3 is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
WebKitGTK is the port of the portable web rendering engine WebKit to the GTK platform.

Security Fix(es):

* webkit: visiting a malicious website may lead to address bar spoofing (CVE-2023-42843)

* webkit: heap use-after-free may lead to arbitrary code execution (CVE-2023-42950)

* webkit: processing malicious web content may lead to a denial of service (CVE-2023-42956)

* chromium-browser: Use after free in ANGLE (CVE-2024-4558)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.5 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in WebKit that may allow a remote attacker to conduct spoofing attacks by exploiting an inconsistent user interface issue. By tricking a victim into visiting a specially crafted website, the attacker could perform address bar spoofing.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: webkit: visiting a malicious website may lead to address bar spoofing
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: webkit: visiting a malicious website may lead to address bar spoofing

notes.text: A heap use-after-free vulnerability was found in WebKit. Exploiting this flaw involves processing maliciously crafted web content, which may result in arbitrary code execution.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: webkit: heap use-after-free may lead to arbitrary code execution
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This vulnerability is Imporatant because it affects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability (CIA) of systems, with a high severity rating.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: webkit: heap use-after-free may lead to arbitrary code execution

notes.text: A flaw was found in WebKit. This issue may allow an attacker to trigger a denial of service condition by convincing a victim to visit a specially crafted website.

notes.text: Use after free in ANGLE in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.155 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)
notes.title: Vulnerability description
